data.title: Another version of AOE II HD undetected
data.body:
Hi, I've downloaded some random version (just like to test you engine) and found new combination for detection:

``` python
age2_hd = (
    "Forgotten Empires HD",
    True,
    {'AoK HD.exe', 'data/empires2_x1.dat'},
)
```

Hope it does help someone. If you tell me how to find version, I'll check it.

Thank you.

data.title: CMake Error // no module named cython on mac Mavericks
data.body:
I have completed the Prerequisite steps for Mac OS X and then, when I run the command `./configure --mode=release --cpp-compiler=g++-4.9` I get the following error related to cython:

```
   CMake Error at buildsystem/modules/FindPython.cmake:29 (message):
  failed:

  /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/bin/python3 -c 'import
  cython; print(cython.__version__)'

  Traceback (most recent call last):

    File "<string>", line 1, in <module>

  ImportError: No module named 'cython'
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  buildsystem/modules/FindCython.cmake:14 (py_exec)
  buildsystem/HandlePythonOptions.cmake:7 (find_package)
  CMakeLists.txt:57 (include)

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
```

Any help? Thanks!

data.title: shell expansions for game path entry
data.body: resolves #425

data.title: make fails for every run after the first during generating the codegen depencies because of slp.cython.so
data.body:
The following should reproduce it 

```
./configure & make & make #or configure 
```

I get 

```
[...]
 Call Stack (most recent call first):
 CMakeLists.txt:72 (doxygen_configure)

 codegeneration depends on non-.py module
 openage/convert/slp.cpython-34.so
 CMake Error at buildsystem/codegen.cmake:25 (message):
 failed to get target list from codegen invocation
 Call Stack (most recent call first):
 libopenage/CMakeLists.txt:55 (codegen_run)
```

   [...]

After some debugging by TheJJ it appears that during the first make run, the slp.cython.[46].so gets generated by cython and that is then taken into consideration on finding the dependencies during the second run and it fails that condition. I also want to add, that make mrproper doesn't remove these files (and some others like the gen'ed .cpp and .h files and some **init**.py files). Maybe this assumption is wrong, but in my naive view I would expect mrproper  to clean everything added by the build probcess. This would be a different issue than this one though, if it even is one.

data.title: Use opus/libogg API via cython instead of opusenc binary
data.body:
With our Cython interface, we can easily use the `opus` api directly to convert `wav` files to `opus`. For packing it in the `ogg` container, we must use `libogg`.
Should be a bit faster than the current approach of calling the `opusenc` binary for each conversion.

edit: changed from "use opusfile" to "use opus" because opusfile can't encode.

data.title: ci: let build steps depend on each other
data.body: This should pervent that style issues are burried in all the output.

data.title: Single .slp file conversion from .drs archive
data.body:
simplified the filesystem abstraction api with more default parameters

added script for converting a single file from a drs to a png to aid #389 .

data.title: Write slp parser in cython
data.body:
To enhance the code optimizations, the SLP reader in `openage/convert/slp.py` should be written in cython. Currently, this is the bottleneck for the asset conversion.

And if that's too slow as well, we can think about using C++ for it...

data.title: Better graphics handling for unit data
XDG-App packaging
data.body:
You should try packaging openage as XDG-App for easier distribution.

Probably depends on #86 

See https://wiki.gnome.org/Projects/SandboxedApps and https://github.com/alexlarsson/xdg-app

data.title: Monk conversions instead of killings
data.body:
I hope this fixes #375 
priests don’t get attack ability any more but instead convert ability. I also added a attribute remove function so that the owner attribute can be replaced. 
This is my first contribution so go easy on me :)

data.title: hud: draw all available shortcuts in the right corner
data.body: closes #420

data.title: Fix: Civilian holding ressources when idled
data.body:
Civilian where taking theirs idle sprite even when holding resources.
Since the carrying sprite is walking, we have to stop the frame update when it happened.

It's my first contribution, and I have some difficulties with git, so I've made just a tiny commit for the first time.

data.title: Support shell expansions in original game path
data.body:
When entering the path to the original game installation, `~` and `$HOME` can't be used.

A simple replace with the environment variable value is probably sufficient.

data.title: convert: fixed game_versions no longer being a str
data.body: as reported by matt4 on irc.

data.title: The game should probably use locale
data.body:
The game should call _setlocale_ to set the correct locale for the libc. For now it's working entirely in C locale. (there are some hacks in run.cpp that set an OS locale to do some stuff and then set locale back to C)

I've discovered that when was integrating Qt. The Qt library calls _setlocale_ and that kills all units except the sheep (probably because the data file parsing breaks).

(occurs with fr_FR.UTF-8)

data.title: QtQuick GUI
data.body:
I've started the integration of the QtQuick as an ingame GUI. Current state is that it can render the game an the QtQuick scene at the same time.

Simple hardcode version to be able to understand the workings is on **different** branch: https://github.com/ChipmunkV/openage/tree/qt-gui-minimal

There is some simple stuff left to do: resize, input and actual QML code of the skin. (I won't start from that)
Locale troubles too: https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/issues/423

I'll start from the more important question: the connection to the game logic. For now, I can't see how that can be done without at least the separation of the main engine from the SDL initialization code.

data.title: Star Wars Galactic battlegrounds support
data.body:
Hi there,

I was wondering if this engine re-implementation could support Star Wars:Galactic battlegrounds assets; it's one of my favorite games (I like it a lot more than the vanilla ages of empire II).

It is using (as far as I know) the same engine, with some custom modifications, like Flying units, shields, energy and such.

http://www.gog.com/game/star_wars_galactic_battlegrounds_saga

Related:
* AOE I support #808 
* ROR support #785

data.title: draw all available shortcuts in the right corner
data.body:
Have done this [Todo](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/compare/master...spjoe:feature/shortcutRendering?expand=1#diff-3cd26de8330566a41cadb63f7de53cccL146)

Features:
- gets binded actions directly from global input context and current output mode.
- gets shortcut configuration from input manager.

![EditorMode](http://fs5.directupload.net/images/151219/loscthup.png)
![CreationMode](http://fs5.directupload.net/images/151219/f36b3kho.png)
![ActionMode](http://fs5.directupload.net/images/151219/duvue4a4.png)

data.title: [WIP]coords with c++ templates
added missing dev dependency python-pylint for arch linux
Improvments of the team colors shader
data.body:
- Made the number of possible player colors variable (assets/converted/player_palette.docx)
- Simplified equals with epsilon checks
- Introduces a way to share common functions between shaders
  - Shader constructor takes a list of shader code snippets instead of on code char array
  - removed shader header from shaders.
  - add equalsEpsilon.glsl as first shared shader code.
- game_renderer derives number of player colors from player_color_lines

data.title: AOE HD Edition downloaded with Steam supported ?
data.body:
Is AOE HD Edition downloaded with Steam supported ? I have the following errors : 

```
$ ./run game
INFO [py] No converted assets have been found
media conversion is required.
please provide your AoE II installation dir:
> /home/hadim/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Age2HD
INFO [py] Game version(s) detected: Forgotten Empires
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "run.py", line 15, in init run (/opt/local/openage/openage/run.cpp:832)
    main()
  File "/opt/local/openage/openage/openage/__main__.py", line 89, in main
    return args.entrypoint(args, cli.error)
  File "/opt/local/openage/openage/openage/game/main.py", line 33, in main
    if not convert_assets(assets, args):
  File "/opt/local/openage/openage/openage/convert/main.py", line 101, in convert_assets
    srcdir = mount_drs_archives(srcdir, args.game_version)
  File "/opt/local/openage/openage/openage/convert/main.py", line 60, in mount_drs_archives
    mount_drs("data/graphics.drs", "graphics")
  File "/opt/local/openage/openage/openage/convert/main.py", line 50, in mount_drs
    result.joinpath(target).mount(DRS(drspath.open('rb')).root)
  File "/opt/local/openage/openage/openage/util/fslike/path.py", line 98, in open
    return self.fsobj.open_r(self.parts)
  File "/opt/local/openage/openage/openage/util/fslike/directory.py", line 42, in open_r
    return open(self.resolve(parts), 'rb')
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: b'/home/hadim/.steam/steam/steamapps/common/Age2HD/data/graphics.drs'
```

The game directory contains : 

```
$ ls
221380_install.vdf       libcurl-ttv.dll     SP Replay.aoe2spreplay
AoKdump                  libeay32-ttv.dll    SP Replay v4.3.DBG @2015.10.11 010801.aoe2spreplay
AoK HD.exe               libmfxsw32.dll      SP Replay v4.3.DBG @2015.10.11 011311.aoe2spreplay
avutil-ttv-51.dll        libmp3lame-ttv.dll  SP Replay v4.3.DBG @2015.10.11 011342.aoe2spreplay
BVT_FULL.ahk             Logs                ssleay32-ttv.dll
BVT_INDIVIDUAL_TEST.ahk  mods                steam_api.dll
_CommonRedist            player1 (1).hki     Support
curl-ca-bundle.crt       player1 (2).hki     swresample-ttv-0.dll
Docs                     resources           twitchdll
launch.ahk               rge-test.txt        twitchsdk_32_release.dll
Launcher.exe             SaveGame            zlibwapi.dll
launcher_res             scenariobkg.bmp
```

data.title: pylint: fix code or suppress false positives for pylint 1.5.1
data.body: No more failing checks.

data.title: convert: Check for game version in only one place
data.body:
Introduce GameVersion enum, and store an instance once determined.
Everybody else can switch version-specific code upon it, instead of
reinventing the wheel

I'm using [enum](https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/enum.html), which is available as of python 3.4 - didn't find a note how backwards compatible you want to be.

data.title: dead units receive damage
data.body:
I noticed this when attacking the enemy TC with lots of archers, who currently do splash damage: When one of them is near to the TC center, where the arrows arrive, he is being damaged, and quickly dies. I had him selected at that point.
His corpse remains selected (white circle), and keeps its health bar, until it is decayed. The health bar grows unlimited from the "0" point to the left, when he receives further damage.

data.title: Thread local storage
data.body:
In reference to #404 

@TheJJ instead of just failing, i have added fallback for thread_local storage. Now, `openage` compiles with AppleClang.
